description: Ms. codex. Title from leaf 1a. Manuscript erroneously foliated beginning on the front flyleaf. Record follows erroneous foliation. Physical description: 16 lines per page; written in naskh in black on glazed, laid European paper. Rubrication and catchwords; marginal notes. Mild staining. Origin: Jumādá II 1229 H [1814], in the hand of the author (leaf 88b). Incipit (muqaddimah): في بيان مهية الاستصحاب وحقيقته وفيه مقامات
author: Kilbāsī, Muḥammad Mahdī ibn Muḥammad Ibrāhīm, -1875 or 1876
abstract: Holographic copy of a treatise on the presumption of the state of continuity, comprising a muqaddimah and six bāb; missing at least one leaf at the beginning.
extent: 87 leaves : paper ; 150 x 102 (104 x 63) mm bound to 151 x 104 mm
provenance: Stamp of the Kitābkhānah-i Majd al-Dīn on leaf 1a.
creator: Kilbāsī, Muḥammad Mahdī ibn Muḥammad Ibrāhīm, -1875 or 1876
كلباسي، محمد مهدي بن محمد ابراهيم، -1875 or 1876
subject: Istiṣḥāb (Islamic law)—Early works to 1800
binding_note: Limp olive green leather with blind-tooled fillets.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
